[{"role":"system","content":"You are a strict security code auditor. You MUST output a single JSON object and nothing else. The object MUST follow exactly this schema: {"is_vuln": "yes" | "no", "cwe": "CWE-###" or null, "title": "short finding title", "rationale": "1-3 sentences explaining why this is or is not a vulnerability"}. Do not add any other top-level properties. Do not wrap the JSON in backticks. Do not explain anything outside the JSON."},{"role":"user","content":"Analyse the following code and fill the JSON object. If the code is safe, set "is_vuln": "no" and "cwe": null. Code:

>>>

Respond with the JSON object only:"}]

response.output: {"is_vuln": "yes", "cwe": "CWE-78", "title": "OS Command Injection", "rationale": "The application directly concatenates user-controlled input from the 'p' request parameter into an OS command executed by Runtime.getRuntime().exec(). This allows an attacker to inject arbitrary commands by manipulating the 'p' parameter."}

response.output: {"is_vuln": "yes", "cwe": "CWE-502", "title": "Deserialization of Untrusted Data", "rationale": "The use of `ObjectInputStream.readObject()` with input from an untrusted source (`req.getInputStream()`) allows an attacker to provide specially crafted serialized objects. Deserializing these objects can lead to arbitrary code execution on the server, a critical vulnerability."}

parts.text: {"is_vuln": "yes", "cwe": "CWE-502", "title": "Deserialization of Untrusted Data", "rationale": "The use of `ObjectInputStream.readObject()` with input from an untrusted source (`req.getInputStream()`) allows an attacker to provide specially crafted serialized objects. Deserializing these objects can lead to arbitrary code execution on the server, a critical vulnerability."}

vars.code: ObjectInputStream in = new ObjectInputStream(req.getInputStream()); Object o = in.readObject(); // CWE-502
vars.label: yes
